Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Good location, lacking in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Marianne O
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11:30 am to the hotel. The person at the front desk told us that we could drop off our bags in the baggage room and come back in a few hours because check in was at 3pm. The response was so automatic and so cold. He told the same thing to several other fellow travellers who tried to check in after us and they were upset as well. He offered no brochure telling us where to go to eat, or what sights to check out first. It was business as usual for him. The great thing about this hotel is that it is walking distance from 2 metro stations - Europe & Rome - so it was very easy getting around. The room was clean and nice. However, my sister and I would not stay here again because of the lack of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for room 65”
Reviews.Author: cumbriancouple
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location in peaceful neighbourhood situated 2 minutes walk from Rome Metro. In the immediate area there are plenty of super markets, patissieres and the bistro Neva cuisine at the end of the street is one of the best in Paris (see separate review). The Sacre Coeur and Moulin Rouge are within walking distance (a good walk). The standard doubles are very small but thats to be expected in a city. The rooms were well serviced and spotlessly clean. We were initially in room 37 at the rear on the third floor and asked to be moved because when you opened the window you were met with the back wall of the nearby railway station which you could literally reach out and touch. The reception staff (in particular Alex) bent over backwards to get us moved to another room (65). Although still at the rear this room was on the 6th floor and was set back from the station by about 50 metres, it also had a small balcony and amazing unobstructed views of The Eiffell Tower. You do get noise from the railway but it never bothered us. We got a good deal through Travel republic paying about half the going rate. We fully recommend and if we got a similar deal then we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cervantes - Revisited !!”
Reviews.Author: Steve A
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Hotel Cervantes for our 9th Wedding anniversary, just under Four years ago (June 2008) as my wife couldn't come on this short break, due to work commitments i decided to go solo, and ended up staying in room 53, the previous room was 52. when i arrived last Thursday (29th March) it was like visiting an old friend, even though i couldn't check in till 3pm (i arrived @10:45) i was allowed to leave my holdall in the luggage room on the ground floor, and was made to feel very welcome by the young lady on reception whose English was absolutley perfect, far better than my French!! Room 53 was exactly like Room 52, but just a little bit smaller These are Premier Rooms overlooking Rue de Berne with their own Balconies. it was just like coming home to a place you know and trust and are happy at. - The Bathroom is a bit on the small side but it works, one downside with the bathroom is when you have a shower however careful you are water still ends up on the floor, due to the small screen over the bath!! - i laughed as i remembered it from the previous visit. The Breakfast room is in the basement of the Hotel, and is a little tight on Space, the breakfast is priced at around 9 Euros for one but you can have as much or as little as you want, the morning pastries and rolls and cold meats + Cheeses are all excellent, Tea , Coffee, and fruit juices are also available. Transport links are excellent with Rome metro Station (Line 2) being the nearest station at a Three minute walk away, Two other Metro stations are only a five minute walk away, I managed to walk to Galleries La Fyette on Boulevard Hausmann in less than 15 Minutes Flat!! from the Hotel. To sum up - Hotel Cervantes is not quite in the centre of Paris, but it's quiet, clean and convinient, with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Kay M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! I spent 6 nights here with my boyfriend and we got the best service and it was it a wonderful location. Not too touristy but right next the metro so it was perfect! We loved the fact that most of the menus at neighboring restaurants were not in English so we truly ate like Parisians; which was delicious! Cute market very close along with stores and all the Paris sights. Also, the bed is amazing. So comfortable, along with a decent sized bathroom for a room in the city! Highly recommend this hotel to anyone, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: justvisiting_9
Reviews.Content: I booked a special Expedia rate for 2 nights, then 12 hours later tried to cancel due to illness. After Expedia's efforts, the manager declined to allow even a partial refund or a credit to be used in the future even though they could have easily covered the vacancy due to being sold out. Not nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: George P
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris at the begining of march this year. We loved this hotel and our room had a wonderful view of the Eiffel tower . The room was adequate for our needs, very clean and tidy. The Wi fi in the room was brilliant to have and a safe to keep our personal items was great. Breakfast was better than expectations and we went every morning of our stay. We loved this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel ideal for a city break”
Reviews.Author: d_benson1
Reviews.Content: We found this rather small hotel perfect for our 3 night stay in Paris. Our room was well decorated and from our balcony we had a lovely view of the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast was very good and the staff very helpful. Would recommend this hotel which is probably a good 30 minutes walk from several main attractions. We did manage to get a good deal on this hotel but noticed the normal tariff is rather expensive. We ate at the Italian restaurant next door but were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cway56
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the Rome Metro station, Nice Friendly people working there, rooms aren't all that big, breakfast is modest, but you can get a hot breakfast or a typical continental breakfast. The rooms and bathrooms were clean, and it's located on a small one way street. Restaurants, patisserie very close, and around the block it is just a small french neighborhood, any kind of store you care to shop at.

Reviews.Title: “Twelve days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ItajaiOA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cervantes is an excellent option for many good reasons: nearby metro and train station, restaurants (moroccain, thai, italian, french, russian, indian cousines), patisseries, cafes, theater,libraries and antiquarians. From the metro station Rome or Blanche you have access to all touristic attractions you intend to visit, from Eiffel Tower to Versailles Palace. The Hotel Cervantes' personnel are very polite and kindeful to help the guest. Some of them speaks french, English or Spanish as second language.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a citytrip”
Reviews.Author: TaylorAl
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for Christmas. Although the Christmas spirit wasn't really available in the hotel, it was a neat and clean hotel. The rooms aren't very big and the breakfast was simple, but it was fine. The people were friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mariana M
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nicely located and easy to get around Pairs, rooms not big, but very clean and comfortable. Staff member helpful and polite, defiantly stay here again. didn't eat in so don't know much. but overall very Good hotel, and i managed to get it at a good discount price.

Reviews.Title: “100% recommended! Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: arron272009
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an amazing position for transport, easy to get around Paris, hotel staff are really friendly and helpful, fresh made breakfast and room service every morning, will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, extremely small room”
Reviews.Author: Sonja B
Reviews.Content: The location is quite central with good connection to public transport. My room right under the roof was very small though. Since I'm not very tall, it was ok, but otherwise I wouldn't have been able to stand in the shower. Breakfast was very nice on a buffet. They offer a good variety of food. As I said before: nice Hotel, only the size of my room was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel if you can get it at the right price!”
Reviews.Author: OandRee
Reviews.Content: To start with I want to talk about how to find the hotel! We got the metro in from the airport for around 9 euros each rather than the 50-70 we were told a taxi would cost. This was easy and quick. Once you arrive at the Rome Metro you are only 2 mins from the hotel. Walk out of the metro, up the stairs, turn 180 degrees and it is the first road on your right. It is slightly confusing as the hotel is on the Rue de Berne but the road you turn right on is the Rue de Moscou. This road forks after about 50 metres and the Rue de Berne is the right hand one. As we arrived in the dark and the rain it would have been good to know this first so I thought I would mention it so others could avoid getting confused/wet! The hotel staff speak good English and are polite and helpful. The room we had (room 65) was on the back so there was a small amount of train noise, but not too much. The room was fairly small but I have been lead to believe this is the case with most hotels in Paris, and it was big enough for what we needed and had tea/coffee making facilities and a good shower which is always a bonus on arriving home after a long day of sightseeing! The great bonus of this room was it was on the 6th floor and had a great view of the Eiffel Tower (from a small balcony) that was always good to come home and see each evening. We stayed for 3 nights and paid around £300. This was a deal on a popular hotel website that was supposed to be 50% off. Paris is expensive and this did include breakfast so was a really good deal, but I'm not sure I would have paid the full £600 - you could probably find something more central and posh for this amount! The breakfast was good, with lovely pastries including croissants, pain du chocolat and pain aux raisins as well as cereal, yoghurt, fruit, and some hot breakfast which was scrambled egg and sausage. There was tea, coffee, hot chocolate, and juices too so plenty of options and the breakfast room was pleasant, always clean and not too busy. It was about a 20-30 minute walk to the Arc De Triomphe in one direction and Louvre in the other but a good idea is to get a metro pass. We got a 1 day pass (around 6 euro) and used it loads and got quickly and easily to our destinations without too much walking. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you can get it at the right price as it is a good base to explore Paris with plenty of restaurants, boulangeries and patisseries nearby and I would definitely stay here again if I ever come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Do stay here”
Reviews.Author: louise4444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent three nights in this hotel. It is really convenient, clean, and nicely designed. The rooms are however small!! but it was a good surprise - Do however shop around on the price as we got it for £80 per night, breakfast included - not the advertised £150!!! The breakfast is good and more than enough. Halfway between the Rome and Europe metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: eithno
Reviews.Content: Just back from Paris, this hotel was lovely, beside the metro (2 minute walk) so easy access to all sights, room was small but clean (small double beds) you could hear trains but no traffic. Breakfast was only untill 10 at the weekend but lovely. Moulin rouge and montemartre within walking distance, Pizza place next door la scarpetta great value and really nice food (3 course meal for 4 people with wine 120 euro)

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolAWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend at the hotel which is right by the metro "Rome", Rooms modern, clean and a good size. Breakfast was great, plenty to eat which was brill with two hungry teenagers in tow! I picked this hotel after reading reviews from trip advisor and would recommend it to anyone that wanted to stay in Paris. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “January Blues Buster”
Reviews.Author: Larajs
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night break in Paris with two friends. I worried that the photos for the Hotel may have been taken some time ago & may now look a little tired but I was wrong. The rooms are typically compact but adequate for a City break. They were immaculately clean & bright, the hotel staff were friendly & helpful. The only draw back is the train line running behind the hotel but that didn't disturb us too much as we were so exhausted from walking in the crisp air. I would definitely recommend Hotel Cervantes & would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: jharve07
Reviews.Content: Hotel is one stop away from champs elysses. Hotel breakfast is pretty good. Rooms are good size for France . Clean and quaint. Good for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: VenlaJ
Reviews.Content: I really liked Hotel Cervantes in Paris. It is located close to many metro stations: closest is called "Rome", but also "Europe" and "Saint Lazaraze" are in walking distance. There is also huge amount of interesting places, which you can reach walking: many department stores etc... I was traveling alone and I had quite small room, but it was really enough for me and there was everything you can need. Room was really clean and had modern decoration, tv and free Wifi. Breakfast was ok and good start for the day. I really recommend this hotel for everyone, but mostly for young and modern people!

Reviews.Title: “First Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: Zhunter
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel with two other friends. We all enjoyed our time there, finding the desk attendants helpful and welcoming. The hotel is small, no exercise room but you get plenty as you walk the streets of Paris admiring the wonderful city. The rooms are fairly small but well appointed, coffee and tea station, mini-fridge, in room safe, and free wifi if you need it. Breakfast was the same each morning, but there is enough choices to switch up and not eat the same every day. Eggs, various meats, breads and croissants, cereal, yogurts, and fresh fruit to start your day. We asked at the desk for dining advise, the first place was ok, more americanized but food was good. For the second time we were sent to a locale pizza shop a few blocks away, Alice Pizza, we all enjoyed our meal, some of the finest pizza I have had and I eat ALOT of pizza. As for getting around, you can walk a few blocks to the south and find the Metro at the Rome station or head toward Clichy and catch a metro line there. We had a few minor issues in our group, but each was quickly tended to by hotel staff to make our stay more comfortable. If I have any down things to say, the lift is quite small, very tight fitting 4 average sized adults without bags, but that wasn't even an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katekotz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cervantes for three nights and I was not overly impressed. It wasn't in a "bad" location persay but it was definitely a hike to get from place to place. It was close to Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge, etc. so that was nice but it was a very far walk to get to any other sites such as the Eiffel Tour, Notre Dame, etc. Although, since Paris is such a large city, one might want to take advantage of the metro, however we preferred to walk and see things along the way. The hotel itself was clean, but the rooms were incredibly small, very stuffy and HOT. I could hardly sleep because of the heat, and I couldn't find a way to turn it off. Even when put on cool, it blew hot air. The street the hotel is located on, is not actually on ANY maps that we looked at, therefore making it quite difficult to not only try to navigate, but also give taxis directions to get back to the hotel. They had no idea where it was and if it weren't for their GPS, we would never have been able to get back to the front door of the hotel. It is conveniently located to two train stations which is nice. There are some great bakeries nearby with delicious pastries. The staff at the front desk wasn't so helpful, no friendly. I asked one man in the evening if the bar was open and he looked at me as if I was a lush and had the most absurd of requests. When i asked if he had wine, he said gruffly, "we do NOT have that!" No wine in Paris, weird. So I asked for a beer and he went into a tiny little mini fridge to pull out two Heinekens and said "This is all we have!" and slammed them on the counter. So I took them and pounded both, slamming them back on the counter in front of him. Joking. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel and would suggest finding another one for better quality, location for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: MarkD1952
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, his fiance and myself spent six nights at the Hotel Cervantes in November. The hotel is well located, being close to a number of Metro stations and within walking distance from central Paris. Lots of restaurants, boulangeries, pattiseries and grocery stores nearby. The rooms are small but recently renovated and exceptionally clean. The noise from Gare St. Lazare, at the rear of the building, can be felt and heard but is not overly loud or annoying. The front desk staff are pleasant and very helpful, and the buffet breakfast is extensive and varied although the breakfast space is a little tight. My only concern was the airport shuttle service that the hotel advertises. Be aware that the small bus picks up a total of seven passengers before heading to Charles DeGaulle Airport. We were first to be picked up and had to drive through Paris picking up three more passengers at two different hotels before actually heading to the airport. If our flight had not been delayed we would have been tight for time checking in at the airport. All in all a great location in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal in paris”
Reviews.Author: Travelkidd
Reviews.Content: We cancelled our original Paris reservation and booked at Hotel Cervantas on a deal from VoyagePrive. We spent £295 for 3 nights in a standard room with breakfast included. The hotel is close to 3 metro stations, on a quiet side street. We worried a little about noise from the train tracks which the hotel backs onto but didn’t find it to be an issue. We did hear the trains but only during the day and it was not a problem sleeping. The area has plenty of restaurants to choose from (try La Scarpetta, great food and friendly staff, next door). The hotel has undergone renovations and now uses bring colours to give it a modern feel. The standard room was smallbut manageable for 3 nights. The pillows and mattress provided a good sleep each night. Free wifi (with a good connection) is available in all rooms and the lobby. The included breakfast was quite decent including pastries, eggs and sausage, cereals, bread and yogurt. Hotel staff were friendly. Hotel Cervantas is great 3 star hotel, in a nice area of Paris. Well worth a look at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent at right price”
Reviews.Author: nathanwaks
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent last minute on line rate.($125) Hotel is a typical three star but our room was considerably larger than the usual Paris clothes closet, being called premium double. Railway noise not really an issue in room 41, mainly a low rumble, which you get in many Paris hotels over the metro. Friendly staff, we avoided expensive breakfast, preferring as usual in Paris to get the freshest pastries at the inevitably close boulangerie...

Reviews.Title: “Paris 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: Kay S
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Paris for the second time. Seven years ago I went with a tour group and stayed at a fairly decent hotel,with a good very location and decent breakfast. We booked this trip with an airline for 6 nights.It is on a little street off the main street ,unfortuately behind a railroad ,so light sleepers be ware. The room is small but very compact,with most of the things you need. The breakfast was a little skimpy in comparison to most of the larger hotels. The same fare each day,the eggs and sausage for the hot not very appetizing. The staff are lovely and most helpful. Lots of great little restaurants in the area,and close to the metroand for the physically fit you can walk to a number of the sites of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angie O
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not fancy, but it was clean and the front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. The rooms are very small but clean and functional. The shower was great and had plenty of hot water. They only provide one very small soap, so bring your own toiletries! The only drawback was our room was on the back of the hotel close to the train station warehouse and there was loud banging noises and machinery noises late at night. The hotel is within 5 mins walking distance to the Metro station and a grocery store, 5 min walk to a great bakery, and there are 2 great bistros within a 2 minute walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay- worth the price”
Reviews.Author: WanderWoman0001
Reviews.Content: Stayed 09/11 and enjoyed the hotel. Great location! Room was small but well appointed and did include coffee/tea making supplies which was nice. The breakfast was very nice and I ate the best yoghurt I have ever had there. Walking distance to many attractions and a very nice restaurant next door with great pizza. Helpful and friendly staff. The only thing I did not care for was the view-overlooking the roof of the car park next door, but then we didn't really spend much time in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RG22UK
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights at the start of September 2011. We did the usual check on different hotel booking websites and she found this but it was a little expensive. We took a gamble on the lastminute secret hotel and were very pleased when this came up as the resultant accommodation :-) We drove over from the UK and found a secure carpark just round the corner, literally 3 minutes walk away (the carpark was a little steep at ~€20 per 24 hours but very safe compared to the street parking where we saw several drivers using the bumpers of the other cars to figure out where they were in their parallel parking, a norm in Paris it seems). Nearby there are plenty of restaurants and if you use the tripadvisor app you wont even see them all as there's so many. Two metro stations are within a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is down a very quiet road on the frontside and the back eventually backs onto the train lines. Please dont let this put you off, our room was towards thi side and the only times we noticed any noise was when we weren't talking and had the television and AC off. All of the staff were very helpful and spoke great English. Notably, we bought a Disneyland ticket from a website and needed to print the confirmation out. The lady covering the evening shift was more than happy to do this even though the hotel sell tickets themselves and probaby make a slight cut from those tickets. Reading reviews of Paris hotels we were aware that rooms were smaller in general than other European cities, room 25 was an adequate size for the two of us with enough storage and space beneath the bed for our bag (please note that it was a large holdall style bag though so rigid suitcases wouldn't fit). The only downside was the bathroom which was small. The door opened inwards pretty much onto the sink and then pushed further...onto the toilet. However, it was clean and hot water was delivered instantly. The rooms look great (loads of photos around so i wont go on about that) and they have a safe, wifi, lcd tv, etc, etc, no complaints at all. For English speakers there's only 2 English tv channels which are BBC Worldwide news and CNN if I remember rightly. The TV has a built in DVD player though so bring some along if you plan on spending any amount of time in the room. Unfortunately the reception desk does not have a library to borrow but then again...they would probably be in French anyway! As a warning to any families, and a heads up to any couples, channel 70 is a free to view french 'adult' channel after 10.30pm ;-) We were very pleased with the stay and would definitely return, we didn't manage to do everything in 4/5 days in Paris so a return is almost certain.

Reviews.Title: “A clan room in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: sorrentomagic
Reviews.Content: I was amazed on how this little hotel has Made huge improvements for clients. A good rate and a silenced place

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: cbp079
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The room was a good size-I even had a balcony. There is luggage storage if you have late connections on your last. The breakfast area was very neat (in the basement) very cellar-esque. The lobby area with a computer and internet access was much appreciated. The area is quite good-easy walk to 3 different metro lines, very close walk to the opera and the grands magasins. Also, Place de Clichy is so close with an abundance of restaurants. I traveled alone and not only was the staff very friendly in providing directions, the guests I met at the hotel were also very cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Super accommodation - we will return!!”
Reviews.Author: Carol170981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cervantes Hotel on Berne Street for a week. It is a lovely, well kept hotel, friendly staff and close to everything you need. The Metro is at the top of the street, there are grocery stores, a pharmacy, the train station (St. Lazure) is down the street and to the left - 5 minutes. Our room and the bathroom was very clean and comfortable. Well maintained. We needed a lamp for the desk and all we had to do was ask at the front desk and it was delivered to us. We really enjoyed the breakfast in the morning - there is a great selection to choose from. We were about 20 minutes by the Metro to the Champs- and the subway system is easy if you just study the map or ask for help. There is also shuttle service available back to the airport for 17 Euros each - just a bit cheaper than a cab. Everything we needed was within a 5 minute walk. Our room was at the front of the hotel - we could open the windows and enjoy the fresh air. We definately will consider this hotel next time we visit the wonderful city of Paris. Thank you to the Management and Staff of the Cervantes for making our week so nice and care free. See you again soon. Brian and Joyce Carter

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - will def be back”
Reviews.Author: jaynick
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to paris and what a fantastic suprise the cervantes hotel was. Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location-20 mins walk to the eiffel or sacre coeur and about 15 to the moulin rouge. After reading a few negative reviews regarding the size of the room we found that these were incorrect in our eyes. rooms were a good size,very clean and beautifully decorated - if people are complaining about the size of the rooms it raises the question of what is the point of going to paris and spending your time in your hotel room. the hotel is situated next to the st lazare train station which can be noisy by day but again why would you be staying in your room? our room was overlooking the station and throughout our entire stay our windows were left open and by night the noise from the trains were minimal as there was hardly any trains passing - also if your room is on one of the upper floors facing the station side you get a fantastic view of the tower. the cervantes staff couldnt be more helpful and friendly and even organized taxis for us when needed. we arrived early morning but this was no problem as there is a secure luggage room. breakfast was fantastic - a great quality continental breakfast. to sum up the whole stay - superb and would recommend to all friends and will be returning well done cervantes

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-Jane86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cervantes for 2 nights recently and had a great experience at this hotel! This is our second time in Paris and after staying at Hotel Darcet which was a complete nightmare Hotel Cervantes was like a dream. We had expected the condition of all Paris hotels to be of a similar standard to Darcet however we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at Cervantes. We checked in at 11pm after flying in from Madrid with no troubles, the receptionist was ready and waiting and was very helpful with lots of information. The room and bathroom were both clean and large, our room was on the first floor. The bed was either a queen or a large double and was very comfortable. Wifi was included in the room and the hotel was located about a 5 min walk from Rome station or you could walk to PLace de Clichely. I would highly recommend this hotel as the standard was definitely high without the matching price tag

Reviews.Title: “Everything in a small well presented colourful modern package”
Reviews.Author: malcofantastic
Reviews.Content: English spoken Hotel is B&B Only 1 closeby restaurant, other two closed down. close to metro and Garre St Lazare main station convenient for most attractions

Reviews.Title: “Room with no view”
Reviews.Author: strangger
Reviews.Content: Pros - clean and modern looking, spacious enough for one, near metro station. free wifi! Quiet. Coffee and tea making facilities. Even provided a standing fan in the room Cons - one of the receptionist, female was not very helpful. But there was another one who was rather helpful (dark hair). Bathroom was rather small, no toiletries provided. Very bad : my room had no view at all, the window open to face a wall.

Reviews.Title: “Très bien”
Reviews.Author: dsampele
Reviews.Content: Excellent - friendly staff, well located, nice clean hotel on a clean street, well presented decent sized room, free wifi, comfy bed. Excellent value. Really could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, service, and value”
Reviews.Author: caringmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in the beginning of May 2011. It was a wonderful stay. The hotel is clean and modern with wonderful service. The front desk staff was excellent and very helpful with good English, though we tried to speak as much French as possible (they were very tolerant of our novice French). Wifi was perfect and free, plus there is a computer for your use in the lobby. Breakfast every day was included in our rate and we could have it downstairs or in our room - just had to call and they delivered it instantly! Cafe creme, croissants, and fruit in the morning with our balcony doors open in our room was LOVELY. Though they do have a large breakfast offering with eggs, sausages, yogurt etc. TERRIFIC money saver in Paris. The rooms were great and the size one would expect in Europe (Tiny) but had a nice little closet. We had a premium double and the bed was larger than our queen in the US. We were on the 5th floor on the street side and it was perfectly quiet. The street and area is lovely. We walked to Opera, Printemps (10-15 min walk), and even the louvre. The ONLY downside is the area actually has quite a few homeless folks. During the day it is not bad, but at night it is a bit offputting to be walking by a little homeless colony down the street sleeping/drinking. Kind of smelly, though they did not bother or beg. The area is very convenient, though, with metro stops Rome and Europe basically at either end of the street. We did not eat much in this area - mostly used it as a home base in the morning and evening before and after long days exploring the city. Would stay there again - but the homeless folks really did put a damper on things - You get that in a lot of cities, though. I have yet to go to New York, Chicago, or Boston in the US where I did not encounter that as well. As far as the hotel itself, though, TRULY could not have asked for better. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, accessible and clean!”
Reviews.Author: lilbee1125
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at hotel cervantes directly through their website. If you pay in full, you get a few euros off and also breakfast included. We arrived at hotel cervantes from a long journey that started in London, stopped in Amsterdam for a night and then arrived in Paris after a 3.5 hour train ride. We were very lucky that hotel cervantes was ready for our arrival and we were able to go to our room immediately. The checkin process was seamless, the staff at the front desk was very knowledgable and polite. They all spoke english very well. We stayed in room #15 for four nights. The rooms are reminiscent to those on a cruise ship. Very small, but they have everything you need. The beds were comfortable, everything was clean, the bathroom was small but the shower had great water temperature and pressure. They also include a hair dryer that worked fairly well. The windows opened up generously to let in the cool paris breeze. The hotel does have Air conditioner but we opted to open the windows so get some fresh cool air. Please note however, the hotel is near some train tracks so you will hear some noise from the trains wizzing by. I am a deep sleeper so this didnt bother me much. Our stay included breakfast which was phenomenal! We missed it once because we partied late and slept in, but it was definitely worth waking up for. Breakfast is served from 6-10am every day. It includes eggs, sausage, fruits, cold cuts, cheese, yogurt, cereal, croissants that were excellent, danish, chocolate croissants (to die for), coffee, milk, cream, fresh apple and orange juice. Its a small dinning area but very well maintained, constantly refreshed buffet and deeeelicious! Although Hotel Cervantes sits to the north side of Paris it is very easily accessible by train. It's about 35 euro by taxi from Charles de Gaulle airport and only 12 euro from The Gare du Nord train station (we did both, thats how I know). When its time to see the sights, the hotel will give you a map of the city (which will become your best friend). If you walk up the block you will find the "Rome" train station which makes all the sights completely accessible within minutes. You will have to change trains a few times depending on which direction you're going on but DONT be afraid, its really easy to master. With a little planning the night before, you will be just fine. Near Rome station there is also a nice litle market where you can buy food, toiletries, snacks, wine, produce and etc. The Wine was super cheap! All in all, I definitely recommend Hotel Cervantes to anyone traveling to Paris. I am very satisfied with my stay there. I recommend the following sights: Sacre Couer Cathedral (get ready to exercise), Notre Dame, Seine River Cruise, Louvre, Chateau Versailles (plan to be there a whole day), Shopping, and MOST IMPORTANTLY: the sunset under the Eiffel Tower. The sun sets around 10:30pm and around 11pm they light up the tower and its absoultely amazing. Take a few bottles of wine and get ready to watch the tower light up in the night sky, its INCREDIBLE! Oh.. Dont forget to enjoy the food! Dont worry about gaining a few pounds, you'll definitely walk it all off! Another tip: Get a Paris Visit Metro Pass... they have them for 1, 3 or 5 days. Its about 30 euro per person for the 5 day ticket. So thats about 6 euro a day, very cheap and much better than paying for tour buses and taxis. Stay away from the tour buses!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MLS_in_YVR
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in one of the top-floor, single rooms. Very convenient to metro (Rome station on metro line 2; easy walking distance to other stations). Street is quiet, elegant and mostly residential. Staff at reception were extremely friendly and pleasant. Public areas, including breakfast room, are modest in size, but stylish and very attractive (and not generic!). Room was smallish, but that's Europe! Minimalist in design, which I appreciated, but others may find a bit stark. Bed was fine, though mattress could have been firmer and plusher. Tiny shower room was fine, not helped by the sloping ceiling. No shelf in the shower room to put toiletries, nor hook to hang clothes. Shower stall was impossibly tiny (I'm 6 ft tall and kept hitting the ceiling and walls) and ... because of the lack of a shower curtain, impossible to keep the floor outside the shower dry! Breakfast buffet was delicious, though options were slightly limited. (essentially continental breakfast components, plus scrambled eggs and sausage.) Caveat: The hotel is adjacent to the rail yard of the Gare St- Lazare, so you hear and feel the trains from your room. As long as you keep the windows/doors closed, the noise isn't a problem. And after a while, you don't notice the "tremors" either. With windows, close, you do have to use the air-conditioning, which was effective. BTW, nice view of the Eiffel tower from my tiny balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDDDave
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. Room was acceptable size for a European hotel. Everything was in great shape, comfortable. We had a premium room on the fifth floor which had a balcony overlooking the street which made the stay even nicer. Staff was for the most part friendly and helpful although local knowledge of transportation options was a little inconsistent - this wasn't a big issue. Breakfast was good but after six days, might be good to go outside for breakfast as the same thing is served every morning. There are some bakeries nearby. Good access to the metro and buses. There are railroad tracks at the back so would highly recommend the premium room, which puts you on an upper floor and overlooking the street. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and convenient, light sleeper (reconsider)”
Reviews.Author: twosaints26
Reviews.Content: It has your basic needs, i'ts updated and is close to Metro which is really convenient to get around Paris once you have figured out how many lines are there...lots. Also, if you are a light sleeper, you might want to rethink. Cervantes is right by the train station Saint Lazares and our room is close to the tracks, usually slows down after 11pm which works fine for us because we are out all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice simple room. Very clean.”
Reviews.Author: tavia14999
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cervantes is in a very good location near the Metro. We had a premium room and it was rather small but comfortable and very clean. It was good that there was drink making facilities, a small fridge and a hair dryer in the room. The free wifi in the room was very useful. We didn't have breakfast there so can't comment on that. It was a lovely simple and clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Sabre255
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay at Hotel Cervantes. We stayed 4 nights from the end of March to early April 2011. The hotel and room was very clean and the front desk staff helpful when we asked questions. We had a premium room so the room size was good for Europe- we could actually walk around the bed comfortably. The bathroom was smaller than what we're used to but adequate. The breakfast had a good assortment of pastries, cheeses, meats and some hot food. My wife did not like the eggs though! Two great features of the hotel: 1. Great location. The hotel is within a few blocks of two Metro stations. Very convenient to get anywhere in the city. 2. Free computer in the lobby. We did not bring a laptop but the computer downstairs was always available. I would definitely recommend Hotel Cervantes and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “neighborhood hotel done well”
Reviews.Author: view-with-a-room
Reviews.Content: Neighborhood hotel done well. The building is an older building on the exterior and an efficient hotel on the interior. Two day leisure stay in a single room facing the street on the 6th floor. The concept is similar to other new hotels in older buildings without the attitude. Arrived via Eurorail and walked from Gare du Nord. Google Maps on the Blackberry works quite nicely in Paris. The Rome Metro stop is some two blocks from the hotel. Map your travels in advance. The hotel is located on a neighborhood street and so in a quiet area for a quiet night of sleep. Internet fast and free. Yea! Breakfast buffet is ok and priced ok (or included with the room rate). The breakfast room is quite nice but I prefer to eat in the room so found food elsewhere and ate in the room. Not pleased with the requirement to eat in the breakfast area. The room is a good size with a good size comfortable bed. The blanket and pillows suffice. French doors open to the balcony with a lovely view of the neighborhood and beyond. TV with some 20 channels. Set your own code room safe. Mini bar with drinks and prices for the drinks. (I emptied the mini bar and purchased drinks elsewhere.) Small desk and chair and European outlets. And did I mention the fast and free Internet! A few "lost in tranlation" issues associated with the concept hotel. The shades block the window or the TV. Form before function hooks and shelves. Thin walls. The shower is too small. Small desk with a stainless steel bowl mounted in the desk -- why? Head towards the Villiers Metro stop for the better markets (locals destinations). Head towards the Place de Clichy better convenient stores (tourist destination).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the money in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bigalle_28
Reviews.Content: Staff and accommodations were very anglo-friendly, and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Quiet neighborhood, and very convenient to the metro system.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet, clean”
Reviews.Author: Jon_verse
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single, so it was tiny, with only a concrete wall to see out of the window. However, I just needed sleep, so this was ok. Room was totally clean, and there was a soft-drink mini bar. Shower great, bed a bit soft. Overall, was fine. Very handy for Lazare. 15 minute walk to G Nord. Just 60 euros, so I'm not complaining about the size. Probably would pay a bit more for a proper room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!! So glad we stayed there :)”
Reviews.Author: AshandRoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cervantes as part of our valentines trip to Paris. We chose it as it was good value for money and in an excellent location to travel to tourist attractions. The hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful and the rooms were very clean and stylish. The hotel was down the road from the Rome metro stop where there was a metro every 2-4 minutes which lead to many other metros and tourist destinastions. The only reasons why I didn't rate the Hotel Cervantes a 5 is because the breakfast was slightly disappointing and you could hear the metros quite loudly from the rooms but this was expected being so close the metro stop. Overall, I would definately stay at the Hotel Cervantes again and would recommend it to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: krityur
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was good as it was near two metro stations - Rome and Europe. The street is a neighborhood and well lit at night. Breakfast and wifi are free -- a plus for a business traveller. The room was spacious for Paris standards, clean and modern. I liked that it was a Non-Smoking hotel. However, the bed wasn't as comfortable as I would've liked. I also requested them to wash a shirt for me and they offered to do it for free. These little things make me want to go back next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, friendly hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: PaulaLancashire
Reviews.Content: The cervantes hotel is modern, friendly, spotlessly clean and in a good location.We stayed for five nights and had no complaints about this hotel. The breakfast was ample, stocks replenished regularly and plenty of choice for a continental breakfast. The fresh fruit salad was especially nice. The room was plenty big enough for two, we had a standard double. The bed was extremely comfortable and enough space for hanging clothes etc. The complimentary tea and coffee was most welcome after a long day sightseeing. We had a room on the second floor at the back of the hotel, it was a bit noisey with noise from the trains, but we both slept well, i used ear plugs and my husband just slept as soundly as normal without earplugs. The hotel staff were both friendly and efficient, nothing was too much trouble. The staff on reception speak excellent english, and will assist you with your every need. We walked into the centre of Paris every day - opera garnier only a 15 min walk and the louvre about 30 min - we like walking! We enjoyed the sights, but our favourite was a lunch cruise on the Seine - the best excursion we have ever been on ! The little bistro at the top of the street serves really good food, we ate there twice, as is ther bistro Melrose on Place de Clichy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sparklesixx
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a room here for three nights in August 2010, and couldn't fault it at all. The room was clean and bright (not much of a view, but who wants to see Paris through a window?), and service was great for the duration of the stay. The breakfast provided was a big selection of pastries, cereals and fruit, and all you can eat - perfect to set you up for a day of sight-seeing. Good links to the Metro, though the area can be quiet at night. Would definitely recommend and make another reservation here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: mspeyton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Paris for one night with my sister. It was perfect for what we were looking for. Easy 5 minute walk from the Rome metro station (line 2). Woman at reception was friendly. Hotel itself is quite modern - our room was more than what we were expecting for what we had paid (approx. $130 USD). Bed was very comfortable, bathroom/toilet was smaller but standard for Europe, room had A/C. Breakfast was very nice - a wide range of various items served buffet style. Able to store luggage in back closet before/after check in/out. Overall a really nice place to stay in Paris. No complaints whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Serves the purpose”
Reviews.Author: mOOnLover78
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, but clean and serves the purpose. Breakfast is very simple 3 min walking to metro "ROME". 3 min walking to 3 supermarkets. 10 min walking to lots of cafes and bistros

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelingurl86
Reviews.Content: My first time staying in Paris, by myself, and I couldn't have picked a better hotel! Clean, stylish, friendly staff, and reasonably priced. Located a few steps from the Metro, which was very convenient. The breakfast was delicious. The bright colors of the hotel were a nice contrast to the dreary december weather. Rooms was tiny, but cozy and VERY clean. I will definitely come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Lor74
Reviews.Content: Was treated wonderfully by staff. They were very helpful assisting with directions. Patient with my rudimentary French and could speak English very well. For the price I couldn't ask for more. Not a ton of space, but if I wanted more space I would pay more. Really enjoyed the breakfast. If you plan on doing a lot of sightseeing in Paris and need a home base where you will not be spending a lot of time, this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet street, nice, cute, small, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erin_leigh79
Reviews.Content: Overall I enjoyed this hotel. We had a room on the 5th floor with a small balcony. The room was so tiny, especially by US standards (of course) but the bed was HUGE, definately a king size bed in a tiny room was a little weird. But it was a comfy bed with good pillows. Nice little flat screen and desk. Closet had enough room and hangers. The bathroom was a little too small and the shower was awful and the "door" kept NO water out from getting all over the place. Not enough room on the vanity for much at all either which is hard when traveling with toiletry/makeup bags. The room location on the quiet, small street was nice because there was NO street noise for the 3 nights we were there and always had the windows open. Not much of a view, but nice having a balcony. The location is great with 4 close metro stops (Europe and Rome being the closest). Just a short walk to Place du Clichy for lots of restaurants and sites. We rented a car for the morning we left to drive to Beglium and Luxembourg at the Gare St. Lazare station area (Avis) and it was easy to walk with bags to pick up the car. Driving in Paris is no worse than driving in NYC, just FYI. Might be a bit daunting for those who are not used to chaotic, close driving though. Breakfast every morning was really good and in a nice, quite, clean breakfast room in the basement. Yeah, there's not much of a view but they had BBC news on the flat screens each morning which was nice. Fresh breads, croissants, juice, great coffee, meats, cheese, etc. Really enjoyed it. I would definately stay at this hotel again. The staff was helpful and as nice as could be for French people (they really are all unpleasant people and not just to Americans....I think unpleasant in general). Didn't use the bar or internet area. Oh, and we used our Bank of America World points to pay for this hotel. So don't really know how much it would have cost for the Fri-Sat-Sun nights we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!!”
Reviews.Author: statusquo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights after looking at all the reviews on Tripadvisor. At check in i tried to speak only in French and the woman receptionist spoke back slowly in French instead of automatically speaking in English as so many people do. I find if you try to speak a bit of their language they appriciate it more. Our room was 601 next to the lift on the 6th floor. We knew the rooms were small before arriving so were not too dissapointed with the size. Everything was spotless as the hotel has had a full refurb in 2009. Breakfast was really good. A choice of pain au chocolate, croissaants, danish pastries and bread rolls. Add to that cereals, fresh fruit salad, yoghurts, cheese, hams, sausages and scrambled egg. Also fresh fruit juices and tea and coffee. Very impressed. The location of the hotel was the biggest plus we felt. At the top of the road ( Rue de Berne/ Rue de Moscou) just cross the main road was the Rome metro underground where we found that most stops on the metro were no more than 1 change away. Just further along the main road over the train lines was a lovely street full of amazing restaurants. I am a chef and i was really impressed with the food. It's only a 10-15 min walk to the Moulin Rouge and another 10 minutes to the trendy district of Monmarte. We purchased the 5 day Paris visite card zone 1-6 and we must have saved a couple of hundred euros easily. We travelled from CDG, to Fontainbleau, Chateau Vincenne and all over central Paris. It cost 47 euros and you get discounts into many places also. You must do the bike about tour (Check out things to do) Cost is 30 euros and it lasted 4 hours with the lunch break. Believe me it will the best thing you will do on your holiday, so much fun and we saw so many obscure things we would never have found ourselves. In summary, Hotel Cervantes should feel proud, it's a lovely hotel in a lovely area providing a pleasant stay for it's guests.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel for small price!”
Reviews.Author: Vanderhausen
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris in March earlier this year. Having been to Paris 3 times before I am aware that standard of Paris hotels most certainly do not match hotels in most other places. For example first time we went, we stayed at a 3 star hotel, which most probably would have been a one star hotel here in England! The hotel Cervantes is absolutely brilliant for Paris standards, a million times better than I was expecting! Its in a great location, just a few minutes away from metro station Rome, but the surrounding location is beautiful. As the hotel has recently been refurbished, the decor is modern and boutique-ish, making it very fresh and clean. The room we had was standard double, was very small, but I wouldn't expect anything more for the price we got it at! It was very clean, bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was great aswell. Continental breakfasts are served in the basement, very nice setting with very nice food! With a little supermarker "Ed" at the end of the road, we were very happy with our hotel choice indeed! I could not more highly recommend Hotel Cervantes. We had got the hotel for £70 a night for the room, including breakfast on a deal on travelrepublic, so have a shop around and see if you can get a deal like that - more than worth it!

Reviews.Title: “You get more than you pay ~ definitely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTwins09
Reviews.Content: While the Hotel Cervantes is not a 5 Star hotel with a 3 Start price, I do think that you still get more than you pay. The room is tiny by North American standards (we had the Standard Double) but had a very contemporary and function design with pretty much all of the essentials you would need. The bed was comfortable and had clean sheets. Various hooks were placed on the walls so that you could hang up your purse or clothes. It also had a mini bar fridge, safe, LCD TV and free wireless internet. The bathroom was a bit tight but it had everything (toilet, shower stall, sink) and not a lot of the hotels do. The only downside was the air conditioning. We were staying on the top floor and Paris had temperatures of 33 degrees or more for the first couple days. We had already turned up the AC to the max but it was still pretty hot and unfortunately, the answer we got from the staff was that their AC was already on but it was just too hot. Fortunately, the room had a fan so we were able to plug that in and was fine. This really only lasted for a couple days. The rest of the time the AC seemed to be quite adequate. As for the staff, we had a mixed experience and found that it was luck of the draw, depending on who was at the desk when you had a question. Our experience ranged from extremely helpful (i.e. giving us thorough and detailed directions and drawings to get to a different metro station and giving us excellent recommendations for nearby authentic french cuisine) to short one word answers. The breakfast included with the room was great. While it is the same thing every morning, it was still prepared deliciously and the pastry was fresh every morning. I wouldn't suggest eating it every day but its definitely a great alternative if you need to rush out early in the morning and just need to grab a quick bite to eat. All in all, I found we got pretty much what we were looking for with the price we paid - a clean and comfortable room, a convenient location to the Metro as well as a street filled with a variety of restaurants for you to choose from. One piece of advice - if you plan on taking the airport shuttle to the airport, make sure you ask the front desk to help you with booking it sooner rather than later as it tends to get filled up. Same thing with getting a cab to the airport ( if that's what you want, pending on the number of people, the cost is pretty comparable and a cab is more direct since there's no other pickup or stops at the other hotels). Hope this helps! And of course, enjoy your stay in one of the most beautiful cities in the world. =)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Modern,clean little Hotel with amazing room; although small”
Reviews.Author: marian7capetown
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean and nice ,close to the Rome station for Metro, supermarket nearby for food & drinks, Male staff friendly and helpful, female staff need a lesson in how to treat tourists! Breakfast is very good!!

Reviews.Title: “Humiliating”
Reviews.Author: Kischka
Reviews.Content: At 9:45AM on my first morning one of the cleaning staff entered my room without knocking or announcing "service". I had the door locked from the inside (but it was not working properly) and clearly shouted "NO" when i heard the key in the door. My shout was ignored (she may have had headphones on?) and she opened my door fully to see me standing completely naked at the bed near the room entrance, a few moments out of the shower. I was humiliated and embarrassed. I finished getting dressed and went directly to reception to complain about 10:10AM (there are no telephones in the rooms otherwise i would have called immediately). The receptionist immediately called the cleaner who informed her that she had knocked and announced herself before entering my room, which was not true. Then the receptionist asked me "why didn't you have the do not disturb sign on" and "well what do you want me to do". I was further upset with this response. First, that the cleaner told a different version of what happened, and then the indifference of the receptionist. I had expected an acknowledgement, apology and assurance that this had not happened before and would not happen again, instead of made to feel worse. For the record their "do not disturb" sign is written in french, which i cannot read, while the "please make up the room" sign is bilingual, french AND english. If i was not requested to prepay my entire reservation upon check-in i would have checked out immediately following this incident. My complaint to management was ignored. I see from reading other reviews of this hotel that the same thing has occurred to other guests also. Also, the rooms are extremely small, barely big enough to cope with a standard suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: elainelaine
Reviews.Content: I was there April 9, 2010 for the Paris Marathon. It was very convenient and very close to the M2 Rome station, like a 5 minute walk to the station and 10 min train ride to the marathon start at Champs d'elysse. The room was small but enough space for one person. My room also has a little fridge. There's a supermarket "ED's" at the corner and you pick up some groceries and put them in your fridge when you get to your room. The room was very clean and the staff very friendly. Just the first afternoon I was there the cleaning lady opened my door not knowing I was in there already. If you get back to your hotel late, there isn't much places to eat. I tried this pizza place because I was so hungry called "Speedy Rabbit" down the street and highly recommended. I was also stuck there because of the flight cancellations due to the volcano and they didn't jack up the prices like most hotels. The rates were the standard and during the week it was around 85 euros. Like more people said the walls are paper thin, but didn't bother me much. I was so tired from the day I slept right through everything. They also have free wireless in the hotel, they give you the password when you checkin. The rooms don't smell and smoking is not allowed anywhere in the hotel. So there wasn't any weird smells. No loud noises from outside. The only thing was that I had to keep on asking for more bar soap, they didn't give me new ones everyday. Overall great hotel and definitely recommend to anyone who wants to stay in Paris. [--]

Reviews.Title: “What a great family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: mumof3noisyones
Reviews.Content: We booked this for one night in Paris and we were so pleased. We needed 2 rooms as we have 3 kids but the cost was reasonable. One room had a small put-you-up type bed for the youngest. The breakfast is more than adequate and we all really enjoyed it. The hotel isn't too far from the main tourist areas but is tucked away in a quiet but pretty street. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Calle77
Reviews.Content: Completely refurbished in 2009. Common areas and rooms look very fresh. Rooms are very clean and all have a flat screen TV, coffee/tea maker and hair drier. Free WIFI throughout the hotel. Above average breakfast buffet (For Paris). Location is good. Close to Blvd. Hausmann and close to several Metro stations (Rome/Europe/Liege). Quite a few good restaurants in the area too. Staff is very friendly and all speak good English – for those of us who do not speak that much French . One evening we asked the receptionist for a good place to have a typical French dinner and was given directions for a great little local place (Un air de famille). The nearby train station and train rails, did not pose a problem to us. If you are sound sensitive, ask for a room towards the street. For us, this hotel was a positive surprise indeed. A very good 3-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “very convenient, very comfortable, very helpful staff!! would definitely go back!!”
Reviews.Author: babaa
Reviews.Content: Last minute decided on Paris, and found this deal with AC Vacay which has the cheapest deal with Hotel Cervantes compared to all other sources. And all to my surprise (even after reading the similar, sometimes over exaggerated reviews..) - VERY CONVENIENT: close to several Metro stations (Rome/Europe/Liege/Place de Clichy) on different lines, which can easily take u to most cites (literally 3min walk to Europe); also located in a side street, so is quite peaceful and quiet - well upkeep of INTERIOR: just like in the pictures, no surprises. Everything is very clean, nice and tidy, incl the rooms. My room happened to be pretty spacious for European standards especially for when I was traveling alone. The design was quite easy on the eye, not too overly avant-garde. And seriously, I think any beds would be comfortable after walking all day. - STAFF: receptionists are very well mannered and professional. Especially helpful for giving direction and information - WiFi: free wi-fi within the hotel, if u have a mobile device/laptop, can easily go online in ur room, or downstairs on the Mac (not the latest version, but will do the job..) - complimentary BREAKFAST: the coffee was quite worth mentioning, croissants were nice (but ur in France, remember?). Not a very big selection on the rest. But that's even more of a reason for u to head out early and try some of the famous bakeries and patisseries. Overall, if I can find the same deal for Paris, I would DEFINITELY go back. Mainly for the easy accessibility of the location, and for the comfortable space I was able to relax in. I think it's a very under rated hotel, but for sure one of the top in the same category!!

Reviews.Title: “super nice place”
Reviews.Author: NiChelleL
Reviews.Content: its a perfect place to stay in !!!!! the room is clean the air conditioner is good its just perfect

Reviews.Title: “Excellent lower cost choice”
Reviews.Author: BlahBlahBlah99999
Reviews.Content: Being American, everything in the hotel seemed tiny. That said, the room was clean and comfortable, and all staff members were friendly and helpful. We had one morning with no hot water; we were given another room to use and the problem was fixed by that afternoon. Transportation is easy, with three metro lines within a five minute walk. If you don't need to be in the middle of everything all the time this hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean room with a tiny shower”
Reviews.Author: j_e_l_l_oh
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I stayed at in France and in Italy. The rooms aren't big but are immaculate. The staff is very helpful and made us feel more than welcome. Also its between two metro stations and there's a market really close by. The only complaint is that the shower is tiny and the pipe does heat up when you're using it. I would definitely stay here again tho ^_^

Reviews.Title: “It was our 20th anniversay and WE LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: LEADCanada
Reviews.Content: Everything was great...the location is perfect, a few minutes walk to the metro and then you can be any where within a very short time, free internet, very nice and helpful staff (they speak english)....great breakfast!! coffee, eggs, sausage, yogurt, breads, croissants, fruit...really good! Everyday, we would walk to the top of the street and buy bagets, chocolat croissants, cheese and fruit ...that was our lunch for the day for less than 10 euros. The only thing to consider is if you have a room at the back of the hotel....you will be backing on to the train tracks. This is a great find and we cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at this hotel was absolutely wonderful, great staff & great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Barrie_OntarioBecky
Reviews.Content: My friend, sister & I stayed 1 week here & thought the staff great! The rooms were small but wer very clean & comfortable & more than adequate as we didn't do a lot of sleeping there anyways. The fresh breakfast every morning was wonderful! We also found the location quite good to where we wanted to be. We never heard the trains, but we were on the other side of the hotel, overlooking the street. We would certainly stay there again given the opportunity. Our entire trip to Paris was awsome!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: geoffchurch
Reviews.Content: Just got back from paris and i can't say enough about this hotel. It's perfect. Everything is so new and clean. Our room was small and had no great view, but i'm not in paris to spend all day in my room. Yes the train station is behind the hotel and very busy, but once the windows are closed you can't hear much. I didn't even notice after a day or two. The breakfast is great. It saves you at least 20 euro each day. The location is great and very safe. They even have a computer you can use in the lobby. i would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint, much more like B&B”
Reviews.Author: Silke1969
Reviews.Content: I suggest you book directly with the hotel. If you try to book via Yahoo Travel or some other online booking, the hotel will not honor the room type. There are some not so nice rooms on the backside of building next to the tracks which is where you will find yourself. There is a continental breakfast in the basement area that is AWESOME. Also, this hotel is walking distance to the Gare Du Nord, Moulin Rouge, the Opera Dist...also, there are several shops in the area that hand build string instruments. The evenings are filled with the sound of people playing stringed instruments within their homes It's beautiful to hear anytime, but especailly after being pummeled with rap out of every vehicle in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience”
Reviews.Author: flynnsky
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself had a terrific experience at the Cervantes July10-16.The staff Christelle, Kelly, and a young gentlemen who was on duty overnight could not do more for us. The room was European size and was perfect for just the 2 of us. The buffet breakfast was served from 6 to 10 am and was delicious. Scrambled eggs,sausages,croissants,raisin buns, cold meats, cheeses,coffee, tea, orange and grapefruit juice rounded it out.We ate early and got touring right away. The hotel is 2minutes away from the Rome Metro, 4 minutes to the Europe station and 6 minutes to the Liege station which we used to go toVersailles. We loved the neighbourhood and walked to Place Clichy and Montmarte. This hotel is in a perfect place to tour and enjoy Paris and we would defintely stay here again. Cheers Dan

Reviews.Title: “I miss it... I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: TheParisiTribe
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week's vacation in Paris. I stayed in this hotel with a parent. The value was great. The complimentary breakfast was the biggest plus. You won't have to hunt down breakfast each morning. They serve scrambled eggs, ham, cereals, milk/tea, hot coffee, yogurt, and a variety of French pastries. The staff at the front desk were nice and spoke English well. Kelly was particulary helpfull. The room is small but I guess that's Europe for you; makes it hard to maneuver inside the room with 2 or more people. You won't be spending that much time in your room anyway. We had a room in the front part of the hotel, so we didn't hear the train. The hotel is not in a touristy place, but in a quiet, Parisian neighborhood. It is only 3-5minute walk to the metro station (Rome); subway is very efficient (no long waits), safe and clean. You can get practically anywhere in Paris once you're on the subway system. Get the carnet, a 10-ticket packet, a good value that has no expiration date. Other tips in your Paris trip: -they offer shuttle service to the airport, 34 euros for two people. Usefull if you need to get to your international flight in time. -you can walk to Sacre Cour from the hotel a good 30-40 minute, start in the morning, stop by the Moulin Rouge for some pictures, then take the metro back to the Rome station from the Anvers station near Sacre Cour. -make use of their FREE internet access near the lobby, to map out your walking directions to restaurants or other places in Paris. -It rained one day and we decided to eat at Scarpetta an Italian restaurant adjacent to the hotel; service was ok, the food was enough to quell your hunger. Keep this option in your back pocket in case of a rainy day. -be wary of your camera battery, I kept running out of battery power in the middle of the day in Paris-- there's so many photo opportunities all over the city/museums/tours. -there is an English option for the automated Metro ticket machine, so don't be afraid to use it to buy your tickets, the metro subway train system is reliable and is a very good way to get around the city. -when coming from the CGD airport, I used the Air France bus which took you near the metro station Charles De Gaule Etoile after two bus stops (approx 45 min to 1 hour), board the train to the Rome metro station (only 5-10 minutes away). I used the bus instead of taking the Metro from the airport to avoid Gare Du Nord station, a big hub where you would transfer. It is a breeding ground for pick pockets/thieves, not particularly good place to be in when lugging your luggages from the airport. -avoid the Welcome Restaurant near the Tulleries stop, the French guy in there is anti-tourist, so rude! When asked where the "toilettes" were, he said in French, "in the plane," he thought I wouldn't understand. What a fool.

Reviews.Title: “be warned.”
Reviews.Author: AllyPeacock
Reviews.Content: Just back from cervantes, main problems are the walls between the rooms are paper thin,I had to go three times next door to ask them to turn down their telly, it was not up that loud, if you sunbathe, there are enough loungers but nowhere near enough umbrellas and the ones that are there are very flimsy. entertaintment is also very poor and only on two or three nights per week. best thing about it is the location it is in the town centre. I doubt if I will be back at Cervantes.

Reviews.Title: “the earth moved for me”
Reviews.Author: Helen1912
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were on a trip through france and on a whim decided to go to Paris for a night on the way home. We booked our room through Hotels.com and chose this hotel based on its location and price. We found that the price through hotels.com was substantially lower than we could get either through ringing them directly or through their own website. As we were in a car, we needed parking but the hotel doesn't have any. Fortunately there is a bit parking lot just by the Rome station up the road, which was 23.50€ for 24 hours. We got there to a pleasant enough reception, parked the car and went to our room. The first thing we noticed was the constant sound and vibration of trains trundling past. My boyfriend, who is a light sleeper went to the reception to ask if there was any chance of a different room. The receptionist was very rude and it made him quite angry - she point blank refused to accept that it was a problem. She then said I could have a room directly above our current one as an alternative - something that was pretty ridiculous. (It turned out that we were wise not to take this option, as they were renovationg the two floors directly above that one! - although the sound of drilling was still apparent 2 floors down!) .Worst of all she refused to let him discuss it with the manager, thus preventing him any escalation of his complaint. To be honest we would have gone for another hotel if it wasn't for the fact that it would have completely ruined our brief stay. The trains stopped at about 2 am and started at 5am ish. The breakfast was good though and the reception area was contemporary, although the rooms seemed a little tired and traditional - perhaps all the building works will sort this out? So to sum up, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is deaf or only needs 3 hours sleep every night. If you have to come here, I would make sure that you pick a room at the front of the building - ours was a standard one, so perhaps you can get a more restful nights sleep if you have a superior one? And don't expect any sympathy from the front desk......!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel at value price in non-descript neighborhood between popular Paris locations.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: The trendy boutique hotel style of the Hotel Cervantes was a great surprise! A small lobby and reception area, decorated in shades of rich purple, contains a Reception desk, bar and comfortable modern seating. This opens up into a cozy back terrace, complete with heat lamps and seating for lounging and dining. The rooms are of typical Parisian size, but they are far trendier and cleaner than the competition and had linens and bedding that appeared fresh, new and inviting. Next to the flat-screen TV was a wall-mounted modern CD-player, great for spinning a few tunes as you prepare for your night on the town in Paris. Bathroom was also modern and refreshingly clean. The neighborhood is unremarkable in the eyes of a tourist, located between Place Clichy and the quiet, slightly industrial pocket around Metro station "Europe" (above the tracks departing from the Gare St. Lazare train station). Several hundred meters down the street is a large postal sorting facility, but otherwise the neighborhood is largely average-Parisian-residential. In Paris, little is more than a 5-10 minute walk from a Metro or point of interest, and for this reason the Hotel Cervantes was a wonderful value for someone with a taste for trendy boutique-hotel style but without the interest in paying for those with the highest profit margins. I would certainly stay again, if the price remains competitive. Staff was friendly and accomodating, with 24h reception.

Reviews.Title: “a convenietn hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MaryLR
Reviews.Content: The Cervantes Paris We (three ladies aged between 42 & 64) were a little off put when we first arrived & were asked for payment in cash upfront. However, once this was sorted – luckily one of us had enough – we were more than happy with our accommodations. The triple room was spacious, beds comfy (the pillows could have been a bit softer), breakfast included in the cost was more than adequate & the hotel was convenient to the local Metro. It was a little noisy from the trains rumbling underneath early in the night but that was not too much of a problem Recommend 8/10

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: some_boy32
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay in Paris and stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my girfriend and i would recommend it to anyone visiting Paris on a short break. I spent a long time searching around for hotels reading reviews and comparing prices and I finally plumped for this one and I have to say I was very pleased with my choice. First of all the location is great. It is in the 8eme arrondissement of Paris which is about a 20-25 minute walk away from the arc de triomphe and the champs elysees. However there is a metro station (Rome) literally a minutes walk from the hotel at the end of the street. The metro is fantastic and can get you anywhere in no time at all with trains coming along every couple of minutes. Its a little crazy at first but get yourself a good map of the metro (we picked up a free one from the airport) and you soon get the hang of it. As well as being near the metro stop there is also a Supermarket just around the corner from the Hotel as well as a main street with a range of restaurants etc. At the end of the day its almost impossible to stay somewhere that is near everything, as long as you are near a metro stop you can get everywhere easily and quckly and the area this hotel was in was nice and quiet and seemed safe even late at night. The room had everything we needed. It wasnt massive (as most rooms in Paris are not) but it was clean, the double bed was comfy, there was wardrobe storage, a safe which was free to use, air con, a mini bar (we didnt get anything from it but used it to keep cool some drinks we got from the supermarket!), a tv with a dvd player (most channels were french but there were a couple of english speaking news channels) and the bathroom whilst being quite small was modern and clean with a very good shower and a hairdryer and towels provided. Also the hotel has free wifi access throughout which was useful. The hotel in general was nice there was a small bar, a computer with free internet access and an outdoor covered terrace. The staff were all friendly and the ones we encountered on reception all spoke very good english, Julie being especially helpful and pleasant. Check in is at 3 o clock, we got there early but there is a luggage room where you can leave your luggage. We had breakfast included in what we paid which was really good. Nothing special but enough to get you going for a day of sightseeing. There was Tea/Coffee/Fruit Juice, sausages and scambled eggs, cereals, selection of french pastries and bread, cheese and ham, yogurt, fruit. Breakfast is 7-10 and you can even get it brought to your room between 8 and 10 for no extra charge. Whilst it wasnt 5 star by any stretch for what we paid it did exactly what we needed. I looked at cheaper ones which didnt look too nice and obviously there are more expensive ones but for a short sightseeing break where you dont really spend too much time in the hotel other than sleeping then it was perfect and id definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Paris on a budget. The only slight negative I could say about the hotel is that the street it is on does back onto some train lines.
