Our room was near the back so it was possible to hear trains going past but it wasnt really loud or that frequent to be honest and unless you are a really light sleeper then it shouldnt be a problem, it certainly didnt cause us any problems as we slept like logs after lots of walking about. That is the only bad thing I could say about the hotel and like I say its a very minor issue but thought it was worth mentioning. One general tip I would give anyone arriving in Paris via Charles de Gaulle airport who deosnt have transport to the city centre organised is to use the trains rather than a taxi. We used the trains and they were so simple to use. We bought a Paris Viste pass for 3 days, zones 1-6 which as well as covering the centre of Paris (zones 1-3) also covers the train to and from the airport. This was 39 euros each and gave you unlimited travel for 3 days. Taxis from the airport range from about 50-70 euros i think so getting the train is much better value. The Paris Visite passes can be bought for more or less days and you can just get them to cover the city centre and not the train to the airport and obviously the price changes accordingly. In terms of this hotel you simply get on the train at the Airport and take the RER line B to Paris Nord station (also called Gare du Nord) and when you get to here the La Chappelle metro station is a walk next door and its on the Blue 2 metro line which Rome station is on (the one closest to the hotel). Its about 30-35 minutes from the Airport to Gare du Nord and then about 5 metro stops from La Chappelle to Rome which is about 10 mins at the most. To sum up, if you are visiting Paris on a short break and are on a budget and want a nice mid range hotel close to the sights in Paris that is clean easily accessable then id strongly recommend this hotel. Ive gone into quite a lot of detail but really just wanted to get across how good this place was for what we were after and hopefully the review and hints will be helpful to anyone else lucky enough to be visiting this absolutely wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ItalGrecoLon
Reviews.Content: My company uses this hotel. The rate is 95 Euros, but I have seen the same rate advertised, so doubt it's anything special. It's a non smoking hotel. This is a pain, since you need to go into a small courtyard to smoke, ok in summer .... Large windows that open. Room is an ok size and the bathroom has everything. Unless you're short, you will not be able to lie in the tub. However, the shower is powerful and suited my needs. The hotel offers free wi fi in the rooms which is perfect. Breakfast is included and whilst not a huge choice, it's clean, very fresh and really, there's enough selection to set you up for the day. The location is good, there are some 3 Metro's close by and Lazare station 5 mins walk away. This suited me since I needed to take a bus to my office. If you're coming from the airport by train, the blue line runs straight to Rome metro which is 5 mins walk from the hotel. Place de Clichy is 5 mins walk away, so ample restaurants in that zone. You can see the top of Sacre Coeur from there. What I like about the area is that you're not the ' tourist hub ' so prices tend to be more localised, yet sightseeing spots are close by. Negative points : St Lazare is close by and trains run under the building. I could faintly here them. I could hear people walking in the room above mine and doors closing. I'm a heavy sleeper, so this was not a concern to me, but if you're a light sleeper, consider this. The train cannot be avoided, but noise within the hotel itself, what I will say, and this is my 2nd stay here for 1 week periods, people are generally sightseeing or business people. I never heard televisions, loud music or drunks. After 230, it's pretty quiet with people getting up early the next day. Miserable reception staff by and large. Would not greet me unless I greeted them. Only ex ception was a young guy. This won't affect your stay, but just found it odd.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff and good hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: AlfieEngland
Reviews.Content: I found the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was quite small and you could hear the trains at the station but this was not a big issue. Booked on lastminute and with the flight this was a very reasonable price for 3 nights in Paris. Location was not great as about an hour walk from the sites but train station and metro within 2-3 minutes walk. Would recommend for those who want a short stay in Paris . Breakfast was ok and bought up to your room if requested at no extra cost

Reviews.Title: “Racist Owner”
Reviews.Author: Neeshakrishna
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend anybody to stay at this Hotel. I am a regular business traveler and this was my worst experience of all time. My company booked our hotel and there was some miscommunication about the dates. We were supposed to stay for 3 nights but the hotel was booked for 2 nights which we were not aware of. When we came into the hotel the owner who speaks NO ENGLISH started abusing us and passing racist comments , I am Asian ( this was informed to us by some other French guests). We were just going to pay for the extra night and apologize but his awful behavior just showed us how little he cared about his customers. His remarks were just unacceptable. Apart from that the rooms are extremely tiny and the breakfast was VERY BAD! PLEASE DON'T EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL ESPECIALLY BECAUSE THE OWNER HAS NO DECENCY!

Reviews.Title: “Wow ... Good value for money in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NgFlyTravel
Reviews.Content: Family Trip: 2 adults and 1 child of 4 years old from Malaysia Date of stay: Nov 2008 We stayed in Hotel Cervantes for 5 nights after experiencing 4 nights at a 2 5-stars hotels while I was on business trip at the begining of the trip. The location is prefect for we are within walking distance ranging from 3-10mins to 3 different Metros. We use Metros to visit all the famous landmarks and shopping areas. With a supermarket round the corner and restaurants nearby, makes it easier to feed the child who is constantly hungry. The Superior Deluxe room is spacious, clean and well heated! We have a room that has 2 open verandah with standing space for 1 pax that faces the street. This meet our requirement to have natural light in to the room. The bed is a comfortable queen size and having coffee/tea making facility in the room is an added bonus. The bathroom is also spacious with a bathtub cum standing shower. The breakfast at the basement is of good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosalindoshea
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel , took a while to find but think that was due to not having much knowledge on the metro system. Really nice hotel , with a nice bar area and reception, hallways nice with different photos each representing a floor on the hotel. Room was small but comfy, we went for 4 nights and were worried after reading bad reviews , but we never experienced any problems there. Only downside was our view,it was of a brick wall. Staff nice, would definately go back. Good location, altho very close to red light district . Good for a cheap holiday ! Book moulin rouge in advance if your going, we couldnt get any night as it was fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, OMG do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: ScoutOut2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so awful, I normally don't spend the time to write reviews but I am taking the time now so that someone doesn't have my experience. Thank god I only booked for one night. It was a single room maybe that was part of the problem. The room was old and gross and yes right by the train station out in the middle of no where. I beg you not to stay here spend an extra few bucks and stay in the main part of town. The pictures are deceiving!!! it made it look better than it was. I think my closet in my house was bigger than that room. My room number 69 do not stay there. YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: daisy111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the quiet neighborhood, close to the metro, restaurants, cinemas, etc. We had both the premium and a twin room, and did not had any problems with the noice at all. Rooms were clean, the staff really friendly and helpful, the breakfast excellent. I will definitelty stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Room 15”
Reviews.Author: shoegal24
Reviews.Content: Whilst the location was fantastic, the room we stayed in left much to be desired. The double room I had booked was tiny - the bathroom too, so much so that the door could only open so far before it hit the sink. The view from our window was of a high brick wall where the main SNCF trains ran to and from Gare St. Lazare at all times of the day and night. To say the trains were noisy is an understatement and prevented us from sleeping properly both nights. Speaking to other hotel guests, it seemed that only the rooms at the back of the hotel suffered from the noise of the trains. On the plus side, the room was clean, the hotel had internet access and included a lovely breakfast. The staff, however, were hit and miss - two of the receptionists were lovely, whilst one was rude, moody and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better - not a recommended”
Reviews.Author: tdskip
Reviews.Content: First the good - the front desk staff is very pleasant, helpful and eager to see that you have a good stay. If you like walking it is easy to get 'local' and also easy to hoof it down to central Paris and the sites (easy = fair amount of walking). Now the rest - the room was tiny, which wasn't a huge deal (sorry for the joke) but the windows didn't filter any light, and after it stopped being humorous that every time I tried to turn around I bumped the shower off it got really annoying. The bed was lump, pillow uncomfortable, and linens old. The Radisson in Boston I stayed in right after this seemed palatial by comparison. Even adjusting for price, which wasn't that cheap mind you, it wasn't a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home @ the Hotel Cervantes!”
Reviews.Author: Steve A
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, and i had seen the hotel recommended on the Eurostar website, the general impression on arrival was very good & continued with a very warm welcome from the lady on reception, i decided to up grade us to a premium room and it was a good choice, our room No.52 did not disappoint, loved the two sets of doors on to the roof balcony, view out & up &down RUE DE BERNE was just how we pictured OUR HOTEL IN PARIS to be, all we could here was the odd train in the background, but it certainly wasn't intrusive, the staff at breakfast were helpful & efficient, with 3 Metro Stations in very close proximity ROME Station being only a 2 minute walk away, transport links were excellent, we stayed for two nights and were sorry to leave, we intend to go back to Paris next year & will definatly stay at the Hotel Cervantes again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lyndah50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cervantes for 4 nights in April 2008. The location is fantastic - within 100 metres of Rome Metro station and a little further to 2 other Metro stations. It is also an easy walk to Place de Clichy, a main restaurant and entertainment area. The location is in a nice residential area. The standard room and bathroom were fairly typically Parisian size (small) but fully functional. The buffet breakfast was also typical and adequate. The only complaint I had with this hotel was that the staff seemed totally disinterested in guests, however they did respond to requests begrudgingly. Despite this small complaint, I would definitely stay at the hotel again for the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: penangowl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the standard room for five nights (average EUR97). Arrived early but we were given our room anyway. The room is quite reasonable for Paris standard; enough space for two big and one small luggages. Only wished the bathroomdoor opens out instead of into the tiny bathroom; it would have been much more convenient to get in and out of the bathroom. Double glazing windows but we do feel the occassional but slight vibrations from the trains nearby. Didn't disturb our sleep though. Staff is friendly and helpful with directions, etc. Breakfast is reasonable and we can opt to have it serve in our room as well. Location is quite good. Close to two metro stations - Rome and Europe - on two different lines, which made it easy to move around. Ed, a local supermarket is just round the corner. Handy especially for bottled water (about 60 euro cents compared to 2 to 3 euros elsewhere), fruits, snacks or even wine. Closed rather early though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: Kezabell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic find, very modern and immaculately clean. We stayed for four days over valentines weekend, in a premium room, which was well worth the extra money for the modern room and queen sized bed. Staff were very helpful, especially the night and weekend staff, and couldnt do enough for you. Room service is included in the price and we had a delicious breakfast in bed every morning of our stay. The hotel is two minutes walk to the Rome metro station, which gives access to all of Paris. Sacre Couer, Moulin Rouge and an array of restaurants and bars are all within a couple of metro stops. The Eiffel Tower is two metro's away, around 15 minutes, and Charles de Gaulle airport is 30 minutes away in a taxi. We had a fantastic stay in Paris and would recommend this hotel to couples, friends and solo travellers. We had read reviews on trip advisor that said there was a lot of noise from the train station behind the hotel, we had a front facing room so didnt hear any noise, just felt a small vibration when trains passed, which we soon got used to. This shouldnt put you off staying here. We would definitely stay here again if we returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ockert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Cervantes for 2 nights. We arrived around 13:00, and although the booking indicated the room would only be ready after 15:00, we were immediately allocated a room. Reception was friendly and free internet at reception and newspapers were a plus. The room was small, but definitely bigger than another 3 star hotel I stayed at 2 weeks earlier. The room was clean. The blanket was hard and needs to be replaced. We asked for an extra pillow (there were 1 for each guest on the bed and 1 extra in the cupboard, but we needed one more - 2 pillows per person is sort of standard in South Africa). I repeated the request 4 times. The first 3 I was assured it will be provided. Only after the 4th request on the second day of our stay was I informed that we are not entitled to another pillow. What a big deal. The breakfast was the best I have had at a 3 star hotel in Europe (from Berlin to Rome to Paris). A choice of hot and cold dishes. The room had a terrible view on the roof of the train station (in the guest book I saw other South Africans mentionng they had an amazing view on the Eiffel from their bed, so there are other views), and the building vibrated when trains/metro passed, but this ended around midnight and only started again early morning. It didn't affect our sleep. The room had duoble windows for isolation-and it helped. One of the most positive aspects of the hotel is that it is situated near convenience stores, several restaurants, 3 metro stations within 150 - 400m, of which we found Europe and Rome the best for our travel purpose, and it is a fresh stroll to the Basilica Sacre Coeur, one of the most amazing sights of Paris, with one of the best views of the city, and some of the more reasonably priced souvenir shops in Paris. Had I not come accross a special offer related to the Rugby World Cup, I may have felt done in. But I have stayed in worse.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: gmogrady
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was clean, it was just this side of a dump. Hotel staff had to lock and unlock the front door in the evening so this tells you something about the neighborhood! Rooms were TINY but clean. Also our double with a "city view " was a view of a brick wall outside the window. I would swear the trains ran THROUGH the hotel in the night. The best thing about the hotel was the nice breakfast that was included.

Reviews.Title: “Room 65”
Reviews.Author: Cassiya
Reviews.Content: If your stay in Paris is brief this hotel is ok. The rooms are small to say the least, however we got room 65 on the top floor which gives fantastic view of the Eiffel tower. Also the hotel is ideally located near a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: assie
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 2 nights at Cervantes in Paris to celebrate our 12,5 yrs of marriage, with our son. It was a good place to stay. We had a premium room at the street side. No trains heard. Room was big enough for us three, breakfast was also good. Staff are Parisiens, they have to live up to there reputation. Metro is around the corner. Would certainly book again. Book through the website (fastbooking) you will get a huge discount (50%) in our case.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: 20luv2travel
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to London and Paris so I was eager to find a good hotel. It didn't have to be the best since we were a little tight on budget and since I figured we'll be spending most of the time outside anyway. I did my research and found that the reviews for this hotel was overall good. And so I booked it. When we got there it seemed that it has been updated since the interior looks alot better than the current photos online. But as we roamed the city by foot and subway(we stayed in Paris for 6 days), I realized how inconvinient the hotel location was. We saw better hotel locations close to main attractions and market places for almost the same price. If I would have known this I would have paid a little bit more for another hotel w/ a better location. Also, I knew the rooms were going to be tiny but it was so small that we couldn't even unpack our 2 big luggages since there was no room in the closet. And so we had to lay them on the floor and it took up most of the space in the room. Overall, this hotel was okay since it was fairly clean but if you're visiting Paris for the first time I would suggest staying close to the main attractions and/or market places as you will save money for making your own food (we made our own baguettes & paninis) and you'll save time.

Reviews.Title: “Cervantes - A bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Skytalker
Reviews.Content: We intended to spend Easter in Paris. We booked Cervantes for 3 days by means of venere.com. Rooms are not ready before 15:00. Except for the reception, very professional and helpful, the rest of the staff were continuously bitching, especially during breakfast. First day we had a premium double which wasgood, then moved in the double, but we assume that was actually a single room arranged as a double. The room we had was very small, bathroom was very small and everything was dirty, totally unacceptable. Additionally it is very noisy as it is located near the Saint Lazare railway station. Although breakfast was OK, the room was very small, personnel not helpful at all. We booked 3 days, but we checked out,on the second day because the stay there was unacceptable. I got far less for my money than I have expected. Parking: as It reads on their website, is possible at a rate of 12 EUR/day. Actually parking is possible in the parking Europa, which is a public parking, close enough to the hotel, at a rate of 21,5 EUR/day. Very bad subway connection to the main attractions of Paris. I would definitively not recommend this hotel to anyone, I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but only for very small people on a short business trip”
Reviews.Author: Erskinemay
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. The rooms are far too small - and our bathroom was ridiculously little. You couldn't really sit on the loo, it was so close to the opposite wall, and if you turned round in the tiny shower, you normally turned the tap off. It's not quiet - St Lazare station is far too close for that, and if the air conditioning isn't working (as it wasn't in our room) you have to choose between the noise of the trains and complete airlessness. The decor is agressively modern, with no Parisian character. The hotel is a long walk from anywhere interesting - the three close by Metro lines help, but walking in Paris is best. Yes, the staff are helpful, the place is clean and the breakfast good - but even the breakfast room is far too small with ill-designed furniture. For the money I had expected more. I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AS FAR AWAY as you can”
Reviews.Author: di68
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted to take our sons aged 7 and 10 for an April Paris vacation this year. After booking a double room on the website (perfectly allowable for an adult and 2 kids, according to the website), the hotel contacted my husband saying they would upgrade to triple room at no extra cost. We both thought "What a great hotel!" - however, the next day, they came back saying that an extra EUR30 will be charged for the "extra" person (what extra person? 1 adult + 2 kids = 3 for a triple room!). When my husband forwarded the email he got earlier about the no-cost upgrade and asked to stay with the initial reservation for either the double room or the no-cost upgrade (esp. since he did NOT request the upgrade), the reservation was canceled in the rudest way (see below). I have NEVER seen such a way to make business and I traveled extensively throughout US, Europe and Asia, with and without children. My advice - STAY AWAY! Here's their final answer when asked to revert to the initial reservation or keep the no-cost upgrade that they offered (and BTW, forget about the butchered English, but I have no idea what is with the reference to Wilson Hotel!): > Dear sir > > We are going to cancel your reservation . > > For security reasons we can not accept this > > So book an other hotel we are 3*** hotel not a family Hotel Wilson > We do not bargain our pricing like this . > Regards > Frderic Battut

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wornoutwalker
Reviews.Content: Good medium priced hotel, breakfast excellent and started at 7 o'clock allowing for an early start. staff very friendly. We had a nice quiet room and no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: traveller005
Reviews.Content: The staff at hotel cervantes were polite, spoke perfect english and were very helpful at arranging bookings and getting extra pillows! The rooms were clean and well presented and the hotel's location was excellent-on a quiet street and close to two metro lines mkaing it very easy to get to all areas including the airport & disney. I will definitly stay here again should I return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Henrikstongue
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, a little off the beaten track, but Gare St Lazare is close, and there is a Metro station a short walk away. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean, I think its has just been refurbished. The staff were extremely helpful and we were able to leave our luggage and collect it later. One slight downfall is that the distant rumble of trains can be heard, but with it being close to Gare St Lazare it is to be expected and it wouldn't put me off using the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Becs04
Reviews.Content: Had a great 4 day, 3 night stay in Paris. Booked this hotel via lastminute.com and found it to be great value for money. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - and organised a room I had requested along with Champagne and flowers - it was for an anniversary! (room 65 is on the top floor and has a great view of the Eiffel Tower, but is quite cosy - the same as any hotel in Paris) The hotel was clean and, although on a main train line, quiet - but on Monday morning we were woken by workmen! For the price we paid it was great and was very close to a metro but personally for me it was a little way out - if you don't mind paying that little extra to be nearer to the centre I would do this but if you are looking for a realtively cheap place to put your heads down for the night then it is great. It has been recently refurbished and looks really nice but I was expecting a more lively bar area however - not very often open and no permanent bar staff

Reviews.Title: “disaster averted”
Reviews.Author: Wairarapa
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay in Paris. The trip could have been a disaster as we managed to lose our passports somewhere between the airport and the hotel. On arrival the very sympathetic staff checked us into our very comfortable rooms and by the time we returned to reception ,10 minutes later, they had printed out maps and instructions for us to report our missing passports to the police. They also had instructions on how to find our embassy etc. They were all fantastic and went well beyond the call of duty. After a quick and fairly painless visit to the police, we returned to the hotel, ate at the next door restaurant (average) and had a wonderful sleep in the super comfortable beds. Breakfast was included in our deal. It was a simple but ample and good quality cold buffet. The hotel is well situated for the Metro and also for exploring most of the cities main attractions on foot. Although the hotel is located in a quiet street, it is virtually on top major railway lines. It is well soundproofed however. Our trip ended well with our passports having been handed in to Air France lost property! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “quiet street”
Reviews.Author: RBlack230
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near subway, short walk to local supermarket , boulangerie, and open air market worth seeing (saturdays), parking garage around the corner if you have a car (if you rent a car you are not allowed to park on the street for more than 2 hours except weekends and the month of august), and not an unreasonable way from the Louvres, Galleries Lafayette (worth a visit, especially for the ladies), and Sacre Coeur, this hotel is on a quiet 200 yard long street near the Gare St Lazare away from the hub-bub but near enough for easy access to everything. We walked to the Eiffel tower from here (a hike) and had a fun time. The hotel is short on fancy amenities, although it has air-conditioning, a minibar, a hotel safe and is clean and well maintained. When we were there the little bar in the lobby (recently tastefully renovated) was never open, even though we stayed several days. The hotel has no restaurant, but does offer breakfast, but the 8th arrondissement of Paris has great restaurants anyway. There is a small "Italian restaurant" just outside the hotel, a good thai restaurant around the corner,etc. This is not really a three star hotel however. Our room was very small (there were bigger rooms), and it is far from fancy. The train tracks are just behind the hotel and it is too noisy to open your windows unless you enjoy that sound! All in all, not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Sang06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cervantes Paris for 3 nights and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel was located on a quiet street, but a stones throw from 2 metro stops. The Montmartre area and the Sacre Coeur weren't too far, and we were also close to the Grand Boulevards and Gare St Lazare. The hotel itself was very modern with contemporary design. Our room was nice and spacious with a balcony. There was a flat screen, DVD player and a fridge in our room. The breakfast room in the basement was small. However, the selection at breakfast was good and enough to set you up for the day. I would definitely stay here again and thought it was very reasonably priced.
